name: inexactly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not exact or not known in detail: The newspaper had somewhat inexactly reported that she was being sued for a million pounds. I was only able to understand what was going on very inexactly.
More examplesFewer examplesCensus records explain, albeit inexactly, changes in the demographic composition of the population in this period.I could only smudge the eyeliner inexactly on my upper eyelid.The professor argued that many axioms of geometry are only inexactly true.
